snippet: The Supreme Court opened its new term by hearing arguments in an important human rights case it first considered in February.
abstract: Supreme Court opens its new term by hearing arguments in an important human rights case involving accusations that the Royal Dutch Petroleum Co was complicit in torture committed by Abacha dictatorship in Nigeria; justices appear to be addressing broader question of whether federal courts have jurisdiction to hear lawsuits against corporations accused of committing human rights abuses abroad.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court opened its new term by hearing arguments in an important human rights case it first considered in February.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Opens Session With Human Rights Case
headline.main: Justices Begin Term by Hearing Case Again
headline.print_headline: Justices Begin Term By Hearing Case Again

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
